0.user_question: Adam had 48 books. If he sold 19 of them and used the money he earned to buy 38 new books, how many books would Adam have?

ost_step.1: Subtract the number of books Adam sold from the initial number of books to find out how many books he still has. Adam had 48 books and sold 19, so he has 48 - 19 = 29 books.
ost_step.2: Add the number of new books Adam bought with his earnings to the number of books he still has. Adam bought 38 new books. So, he now has 29 + 38 = 67 books.
